page.title: 01Wilton and its Environs
page.content: { Wilton}is the only town within the area of study. Some{2km}to the{east}of Wilton lie the outer suburbs of Salibury; Bemerton Heath, an area composed largely of public housing. Wilton is surrounded by{chalk {downland}and lies at the confluence of the{Wylye}and{Nadder Rivers,}two typical chalk streams which provide much{sport for anglers.}Much of the downland is ploughed and carries {winter cereal crops. } The whole of the district lies within{Salisbury Urban District {Council}whose offices are situated in Salisbury. The voters of Wilton also belong to the{Parliamentary {constituency of Salisbury. Wilton proclaims itself the{ancient {Saxon capital of Wessex}and was the site of the rich Abbey of Wilton. This is now the site of{Wilton House.
